title: 0.9.31 Mobile Release
body:
This is an issue to list and discuss remaining issues for the 0.9.31 release.

Remaining issues can be viewed with the release tag.
https://github.com/status-im/status-react/labels/release

We will use this issue to manage the release. (see #6311 for an example)

Release notes: https://notes.status.im/mobile-release-notes
Changelog: https://github.com/status-im/status-react/compare/release/0.9.30...release/0.9.31

0.9.31 will be cut this Wednesday.

Check the [commit log for what's new](https://github.com/status-im/status-react/compare/release/0.9.30...release/0.9.31).
I am starting nightly testing now. Hopefully I will not find any blockers and https://github.com/status-im/status-react/pull/6673 will be merged soon. Then we can cut the release branch.
@lukaszfryc I was slow to add the `release` label to this issueâ€”if we can include it that would be great: https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/6693 (needs to be merged @jeluard )

Sure we can. The release branch is not created yet.

> On 14 Nov 2018, at 10:53, Rachel Hamlin <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> @lukaszfryc <https://github.com/lukaszfryc> I was slow to add the release label to this issueâ€”if we can include it that would be great: #6693 <https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/6693> (needs to be merged @jeluard <https://github.com/jeluard> )
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/6681#issuecomment-438603407>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AHLw7glkY9RkXKtIhZ0HAKwqeJ2R_OP2ks5uu-gDgaJpZM4YZZY1>.
>
So far we have not found any issues. But, the nightly testing will probably continue till the end of the day.

@chadyj @mandrigin we tested 80% of `e8d3e3` nightly and not found any issues. I think we can cut the release tomorrow and continue with final release tests. 

We can cut from top of develop. Apart from https://github.com/status-im/status-react/commit/1104becfbab11506b98028ce81ad6ff869381f51 there is no other big change. @cammellos is additional testing needed for it? We already finished nightly testing for another version (`e8d3e3`). I'm not sure if it's safe to include 1104becfbab11506b98028ce81ad6ff869381f51 in release.
Also, I went through all issues reported after 0.9.30 and have not found any new bugs that would block the release.

i am looking at the offline / online issue, if fixed it would be good to
include, pairing should be safe to include as disabled, i can check the rc
to make sure it's the case, but can be excluded if we want to be cautious

On Wed, Nov 14, 2018, 5:17 PM Lukasz Fryc <notifications@github.com wrote:

> Also, I went through all issues reported after 0.9.30 and have not found
> any new bugs that would block the release.
>
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/6681#issuecomment-438721475>,
> or mute the thread

> i am looking at the offline / online issue, if fixed it would be good to
include, pairing should be safe to include as disabled, i can check the rc
to make sure it's the case, but can be excluded if we want to be cautious

Ok, let's include it.

@mandrigin or @cammellos could you cut the release/0.9.31 from the current develop (`89e0ea0bd2211a2f0462488ebf1166d592cd064d`)? We want to start the final release testing asap.

cc @chadyj

Heya @mandrigin @lukaszfryc what do you think about a new doc on how to cut a release for dummies?

- How to cut the branch
- What buttons to push
- etc

here's the branch https://github.com/status-im/status-react/tree/release/0.9.31
GitHub
status-im/status-react
a free (libre) open source, mobile OS for Ethereum - status-im/status-react

Thanks @cammellos 

Release notes up at https://notes.status.im/mobile-release-notes

cc @j-zerah

>i am looking at the offline / online issue, if fixed it would be good to include, pairing should be safe to include as disabled, i can check the rc to make sure it's the case, but can be excluded if we want to be cautious @cammellos here are release builds. You can double check them: https://ci.status.im/job/status-react/job/combined/job/mobile-android/7385/artifact/StatusIm-181115-082235-1104be-e2e.apk https://ci.status.im/job/status-react/job/combined/job/mobile-ios/3710/artifact/StatusIm-181115-082235-1104be-release.ipa

OK, testing is done. No new issues found. Here is the latest [testrail testrun](https://ethstatus.testrail.net/index.php?/runs/view/1964&group_by=cases:section_id&group_order=asc) (critical section was tested on the final build).

I think we can publish the app once https://github.com/status-im/status-react/pull/6742 is merged

cc @chadyj @mandrigin @asemiankevich

> > i am looking at the offline / online issue, if fixed it would be good to
> > include, pairing should be safe to include as disabled, i can check the rc
> > to make sure it's the case, but can be excluded if we want to be cautious
> 
> cammellos here are release builds. You can double check them:
> 
> https://ci.status.im/job/status-react/job/combined/job/mobile-android/7385/artifact/StatusIm-181115-082235-1104be-e2e.apk
> https://ci.status.im/job/status-react/job/combined/job/mobile-ios/3710/artifact/StatusIm-181115-082235-1104be-release.ipa

@cammellos have you got a chance to look at it?
@lukaszfryc sorry, not yet, I get a 404 for the android link, is there another link i can use?

@cammellos you can use https://ci.status.im/job/status-react/job/combined/job/mobile-android/7434/artifact/StatusIm-181115-130912-1104be-e2e.apk from [latest build](https://ci.status.im/blue/organizations/jenkins/status-react%2Frelease/detail/release%2F0.9.31/4/pipeline/44).

@mandrigin can you help us out with a guide?

From memory we have to do:

- Cut branch (already done!)
- Bump version (eg [here we bumped 0.9.30](https://github.com/status-im/status-react/pull/6102/files))
- Run the [upload_release_ios](https://ci.status.im/job/status-react/job/upload_release_ios/) Jenkins job, and get approval. we can keep running to add new builds
- When iOS is good we run the [upload_release_android](https://ci.status.im/job/status-react/job/upload_release_android/)

Then the rest can be done in the App Store managers online.
@lukaszfryc the one you sent me it's an e2e version, in that one group chats are enabled, we need one that is using `.env.prod` jenkins file
should I kick the build?
Can a @status-im/clojure dev please merge and cherry pick this PR? https://github.com/status-im/status-react/pull/6742
@chadyj which PR?
#6742 has been merged and cherry-picked

Cheers! Started https://ci.status.im/job/status-react/job/upload_release_ios/54/ so we can get a jump on approval.
status-react Â» upload_release_ios #54 [Jenkins]

> @lukaszfryc the one you sent me it's an e2e version, in that one group chats are enabled, we need one that is using `.env.prod` jenkins file

@cammellos we do not have it yet since jenkins build is broken. See https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/6743. Maybe you can help?

~~It has been pretty quiet around here so I thought I'd see if I can fix the Jenkins build problem in https://github.com/status-im/status-react/pull/6751~~ Already done

~~Also the https://ci.status.im/job/status-react/job/upload_release_ios/54/  release job completed and 0.9.31 is in Testflight now for testing and approval.~~ https://github.com/status-im/status-react/pull/6750 needs to be merged first
@lukaszfryc checked on my side, it's all good, all disabled

*&^%$%^&* Jenkins failed again for the upload_release_ios job. Running it again. https://ci.status.im/job/status-react/job/upload_release_ios/56/ cc @jakubgs @mandrigin Multiple Jenkins failures seem to happen with every release waisting everyone's time. eg https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/6743 and release job failures. Also https://ci.status.im/job/status-react/job/upload_release_android/ hasn't successfully run in 2 months so I'm expecting more problems.
status-react Â» upload_release_ios #56 [Jenkins]
upload_release_android [status-react] [Jenkins]
Build 12473 has been submitted to Apple for approval.

Happy Monday y'all! ðŸŽ‰ 
It's Monday and we don't have any new blockers.

Has the testing wrapped up?
